task_summary: Perceive the T block, approach and align to a pushing face, then push it leftward into the drawn T target and retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A robot with a circular end-effector pushes a T-shaped block across a white tabletop into a fixed target outline. The block begins on the right side of the workspace, while a blue T-shaped outline marks the goal near the left-center. The behavior first ensures the block is visible, then approaches from above, orients the tool, and aligns to a straight pushing face. A single long push moves the block toward the target. After motion settles, the arm pauses briefly and retreats to clear the scene. Control and observation occur at 10 Hz.
preconditions: Workspace is clear except for the T block and the target outline
Robot reachable workspace covers start and goal regions
stepwise_plan: Verify visibility of the T block; if not visible, scan.
Detect and localize the T block.
Move above the block with safe clearance.
Set yaw to align pushing face.
Approach and align to contact tolerance.
Execute a leftward push of ~0.2 m toward the target outline.
Briefly wait for motion to settle.
success_criteria: T block ends within the T-shaped outline region
No collisions with environment other than controlled contact
Robot retreats to a safe pose after placement
failure_and_recovery: Block not visible: perform raster scan (bounded retries).
Misalignment or slip during push: rely on approach-and-align before push; rerun alignment if re-executed.
Insufficient push distance: re-execute push with same parameters if higher-level loop allows.
task_long_description.termination: After retreat completes following a successful push into the target region.

frame_3.now_evidence: Tool engages the block near a straight face, indicating alignment and first firm contact.
frame_3.predicts_next: A continuous push toward the left target is imminent.

task_instruction: The task requires pushing a T-shaped block (gray) to a fixed target (green) with a circular end-effector (blue). Both observation and control frequencies are 10Hz.

node_specs.description: Check if the T block is visible.
Raster scan to find the block if not visible.
Detect and localize the T block.
Position the tool above the block at safe height.
Orient the end-effector for a lateral push.
Approach until aligned for contact pushing.
Push the block left toward the goal outline.
Pause to let the block settle.
Back off to a safe distance.

failure_modes: Tool misalignment causing rotation of the T block
recovery_strategy: Short settle wait before evaluating result
Use retreat to avoid unintended secondary contacts
assumptions: Frames show a red T block and blue goal outline; instruction mentions gray block and green target—frames take precedence.
Push direction approximated as 180° (left) based on motion in frames.
Chosen distances/timeouts are heuristic and snapped to allowed bins.
Success inferred visually; no explicit sensor of goal occupancy available in the library.

expected_success_criteria: Final pose visually within T outline after push
